arts.ttl: Jose Mourinho not ‘fed’ by memories after warm welcome on return to Chelsea
arts.sum: Mourinho’s Benfica team were beaten 1-0 after a Richard Rios own goal.

arts.ttl: Enzo Maresca sends warning to Chelsea players after Joao Pedro became THIRD Blues star sent off in just four games in win over Benfica
arts.sum: IAN LADYMAN AT STAMFORD BRIDGE: Joao Pedro was dismissed for a second booking - a raised foot - in added time even though he had only been on the field for half an hour as a substitute.

arts.ttl: Jose Mourinho suffers defeat on Chelsea homecoming
arts.sum: Richard Rios’ own goal gave the Blues a 1-0 win over Mourinho’s Benfica.

arts.ttl: Jose Mourinho reception speaks volumes as Chelsea win despite familiar failings
arts.sum: CHELSEA 1-0 BENFICA: Jose Mourinho had hoped for just his second win at Stamford Bridge as an opposition manager, but was left disappointed as the Blues picked up three points

arts.ttl: Chelsea sneak past Benfica in CL as Mourinho makes Stamford Bridge return
arts.sum: Chelsea collected their first win of the Champions League league phase as they beat former manager Jose Mourinho's Benfica 1-0 at Stamford Bridge.

arts.ttl: Ugly moment Enzo Fernandez is pelted by angry Benfica fans in furious reaction after former star forced move to Chelsea - with Jose Mourinho desperately calling for peace
arts.sum: The Argentinian midfielder ruined his relationship with Benfica when he forced a move to Chelsea in 2023 worth some £120million.

arts.ttl: Chelsea star makes Ally McCoist eat his words with decisive action against Benfica
arts.sum: Ally McCoist was on commentary duty at Stamford Bridge and after criticising one Chelsea star against Benfica, the TNT Sports commentator was made to eat his words

arts.ttl: Jose Mourinho given warm Stamford Bridge reception on return to Chelsea with Benfica
arts.sum: The former Chelsea manager is in his second stint in charge of Benfica and returned to London in the Champions League

arts.ttl: Champions League live updates: Chelsea-Benfica, Galatasaray-Liverpool
arts.sum: The first day of Matchday 2 of the 2025-26 UEFA Champions League season is here, with matches such as Chelsea-Benfica and Galatasaray-Liverpool.

arts.ttl: Chelsea v Benfica, Bodø/Glimt v Tottenham, and more: Champions League – live
arts.sum: ⚽ Updates from European and Football League games ⚽️ Live scores | Read today’s Football Daily | Email Yara Farther north, Thomas Frank will hope his side can find a creative spark, something they have lacked since the start of the season. While they lie fourth in the Premier League, they are ninth for chance creation. Last year, most of the games, it was [Dejan] Kulusevski, [James] Maddison, Sonny [Heung-min] and Dom[inic Solanke] who played. Now we have more or less a new front four and they are doing very well. Maybe we are creating more chances, dominating a bit more. All the right signs are there. Continue reading...
